result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine M Mackay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Sheboygan County.
If revoked, 11 days credit granted.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with any victim in the complaint without prior approval of the Probation Agent.
Return of property: Currency in the amount of $304.00 currently held by the Sheriff's Dept to be returned to the VICTIM.
Restitution of $200.00 to William B. (to be paid as a Condition of Probation) along with surcharges.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - non working hours, standard release. Last 6 months STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion. REPORT BY 4/15/16 by 8PM.

records.addlTxt: Order for return of $304.00 held by WCSD to victim(s). Signed by Judge Carter on 04/08/16.

Defendant Christine M Mackay in court with Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  Court addresses letter with USB drive dropped off at clerk of courts office yesterday (4/6/16) regarding this case.  Court did not read letter nor look at flashdrive as letter was not signed and court does not know what is on flashdrive.  Joanne B. makes statements.   William B. makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney De Los Santos makes statements regarding sentencing.  Matt C. makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the defendant to the following.

COUNT#1:

The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO SHEBOYGAN COUNTY***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases. 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
____No contact with:any victim listed in the Criminal Complaint without prior approval of Probation Agent.
____ No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e
bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Sheriff Department within (3) business days to provide DNA sample.
____11 days of credit if sentence imposed.

RESTITUTION:  $200.00 to William B.  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

RETURN OF PROPERTY: Currency in the amount of $304.00 currently held by the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department is ordered to be returned to the VICTIM. 

COSTS:  $278.00 + $250.00 surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 7 months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 6 months, STAYED, for use of agent with court permission. Defendant must report BY 04/15/16 by 8:00 pm. ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO SHEBOYGAN COUNTY***

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given
(Fax) Dated today, from Agent Stydahar to Judge Carter, requesting to file PSI by 03/29/16. Note: request granted.
Sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 02:15 pm
Sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Christine M Mackay in court with Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.   Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2-6 are dismissed and read-in.  Parties requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and sets sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Christine M Mackay in court, in custody, with attorney Tony Rosario for attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes a brief recess.  Court recalls the case with the same appearances.  Attorney Rosario requests a bail modification.  State objects to any modification.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
